message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the use of large language models in automatic speech recognition, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as deep learning, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.SD (Software Engineering and Programming). Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of increasing the size of the language model, which could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper involves the integration of language models in the lattice rescoring step, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
